parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The object id to be deleted

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

canAcceptBoleto.description: If this order can be paid using boleto

boletoInstructions.description: Instructions in regards to boleto payment for this order

dueDate.description: The due date of the boleto. If installments is greater than 1, then this is the due date of the first installment

installments.description: The number of boletos being created

canAcceptCreditCard.description: If this order can be paid using boleto

creditCardInstructions.description: Instructions in regards to credit card payment for this order

installments.description: The number of boletos being created

deliveryTime.description: How long this order will take to be delivered to the customer

freightCostAdjusted.description: The freight cost adjusted by the sales person. Cannot be greated than freightCost

paymentInstallmentsCount.description: The number of installmented selected by the customer to pay for this order

pickUpInStore.description: If the customer will pick up the goods in store

paymentMethod.description: How the customer paid for this order

orderGwId.description: The order gateway unique ideintification for this order

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

lastName.description: The last name of the user

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

name.description: The reference for this address. For example 'Hone'

addressLine1.description: The first address line. Usually the street name

addressLine2.description: The second address line. Usually the address additiona info for example 'room 14'

country.description: The country.hree letter country code. Format ISO 3166-1. Example for Brasil the code is BRA

recipient.description: The name of the person that will be the receiver of a order, only applies then this is a shipping address

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

acceptsMarketing.description: If the customer accpets to receive be part of marketing campaigns

businessName.description: The business name if the user represents a company

businessAccount.description: Whether this customer represents a business

taxDocumentNumber.description: The customer tax document, in Brazil it is his or her CPF

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

definition1.description: The name of the first definition for the product. Example: Color

definition1Values.description: The possible values of the first definition for the product. Example: Blue, Green, Black

definition2.description: The name of the second definition for the product. Example: Size

definition2Values.description: The possible values of the second definition for the product. Example: P, M, G

erpId.description: The ERP's code related to the product

blocked.description: Indicated wheater the product is blocked for sale. Blocked products will be listed in the products tab however they cannot be added to orders

service.description: If true the product represents a service

trackInventory.description: If true the OmniChat will track inventory. When a new order is created the product quantity will be decremented. If an order gets cancelled the quantity will be restored

sellOutOfStock.description: Whether the product can be added to an order when the quantity is equal or less than zero

variants.description: The product's variants. Including the mainVariant

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

acceptsMarketing.description: If the customer accpets to receive be part of marketing campaigns

businessName.description: The business name if the user represents a company

businessAccount.description: Whether this customer represents a business

taxDocumentNumber.description: The customer tax document, in Brazil it is his or her CPF

objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

weight.description: The weight of the variant in grams

length.description: The length of the variant in centimeters

height.description: The height of the variant in centimeters

width.description: The width of thevariant in centimeters

price.description: The price of the variant in the local currency

salePrice.description: The price of the variant in the local currency

quantity.description: The variant stock, only applies when product.trackInventory is set to true

erpId.description: The ERP's code related to the variant

definition1Value.description: The value of the first definition for the variant. Example: Blue

definition2Value.description: The value of the second definition for the variant. Example: P

externalImageURL.description: The url for this variant image

visible.description: If set to false the variant will not be listed as available to be added to an order

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

product.description: A short description of this item

productReference.description: the refernce code for this item

variant.description: The related product variant that this item came from
